title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2014 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
description: This structured, tight wine has complex almond and spice flavors that partner with crisp acidity and tangy lemon zest and grapefruit accents. The texture with its minerality and tight aftertaste promises aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2015 Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: In contrast to a nose that's more mineral than fruit, the intensity of this wine's voluptuous nectarine and yellow peach flavors surprise. It's dry in style but with a succulent fruitiness that clings delectably to the palate. Finishes long and lean with a tang of steely minerality. Drink now through 2019.

title: Jacob Franklin 2012 Mon Chou Camusi Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: From the Elyse Winery family, this blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Carmenere, all from a vineyard next door to its winery that it planted to these varieties. An intrigue of orange blossom and jasmine leads to soft, velvety waves of black currant, savory dried herb and juicy acidity.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Pernand-Vergelesses
description: A tightly wrought, crisp texture gives the typical cool character of this appellation. This wine is full of white fruits layered with juicy acidity. Full in the mouth, it is delicious to drink although it will be better from 2017.

title: Joel Gott 2014 Zinfandel (California)
description: This is a full-bodied but also subtle and complex-flavored wine. The aromas bring in mild wood smoke and black-pepper notes, then the flavors add ample fruitiness without going to jamminess. The overall effect is one of sophistication.

title: K Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Thracian Valley)
description: This Bulgarian Chardonnay has aromas of lemon curd, custard apple, mango and lemon blossom. It is soft and round in the mouth with pleasant acidity and has flavors of guava, green apple, mango and white peach.

title: Kangarilla Road 2014 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This is a ripe, supple wine, to the point that the dark fruit aromas feature a bit of a lifted quality. There's chocolate and a bit of plum, and a gently dusty finish that hints at mocha. Drink now–2020.

title: Maysara 2012 Jamsheed Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Earthy scents project leafy greens, beetroot and forest floor, but in the mouth the wine opens up with robust black cherry, coffee and cassis. It's complex and detailed, though it retains that inherent earthiness through the finish.

title: Messias NV Special Reserve  (Port)
description: Tangy and showing some good aging, this is a ripe wine that has a bite of spirit and acidity making it dry, with touches of the old wood used in the aging. It's a well-made wine, classic tawny in character.

title: Michel et Joana Ecard 2014 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Rather lean and austere, this is a tight, structured wine. Its future lies in the firm tannins and the juicy red-currant fruit. Wait for this wine and don't drink before 2020.

title: Abacela 2015 Blanco Dulce White (Umpqua Valley)
description: A blend of 58% Albariño and 42% Viognier, this dense and unctuous wine has 160 g/L residual sugar (16% for those who have misplaced their calculator). So? quite sweet, with flavors of Grand Marnier, lemon custard and coconut oil.

title: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2013 Basarin  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, leather, menthol and a whiff of Asian spice. The dense, chewy palate offers ripe Morello cherry, cranberry, clove, and a mint note while hearty, rounded tannins provide the framework.

title: Albert Morot 2014 Les Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This wine is initially lean, taking time to disclose the smoky fruits. It has structure as well as red-currant fruitiness. Still reticent, the wine needs time to show its full potential. Drink from 2020.

title: Albino Rocca 2013  Barbaresco
description: Subtle scents suggesting black-skinned fruit, iris, cake spice and a whiff of toast come together on this. The juicy, accessible palate doles out layers of fleshy berry, black cherry, cinnamon and nutmeg alongside soft, supple tannins.

title: Alex Gambal 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet
description: The touches of wood in this wine are subtle and fragrant. With apple acidity and a crisp texture that balances the wood, the wine is ripe while totally fresh. It is likely to develop over the next few months. Drink from 2017.

title: Alta 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tannic at first, this structured, youthful wine needs time in the glass to become itself, which is a well-made, lightly touched expression of wild strawberry and spice. The grapes come from the Moore Vineyard.

title: Andis 2012 1869 Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This untamed, rustic wine makes a dramatic detour from the normal commercial highway. It has a wild, brambly thread running through the aromas and flavors, plus nervy, sour-cherry and cranberry that mingle with riper raspberry notes and turn nicely earthy on the finish.

title: Vietti 2012 Masseria  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with pretty aromas suggesting perfumed berry, leather, violet and menthol. The soft, accessible palate offers crushed black cherry and licorice framed in supple tannins. It isn't complex, but it is delicious and already approachable.

title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2014 Golpe Branco White (Douro)
description: This is a deliciously ripe and fruity wine. Citrus and apricot and peach flavors are given a lift by a nutty, toasty character. It is rich and full, with minerality and acidity shooting through the attractive aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Martha's Wines NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)
description: The wine is balanced, full both of dried fruits and old wood and spice flavors. It is a rich wine, smoothly textured and with an attractive bite of acidity and brandy spirit at the end.

title: Cascina Adelaide 2012 Baudana  (Barolo)
description: Perfumed berry, licorice, toast, underbrush, mocha and menthol aromas lead the way. The ripe, approachable palate offers stewed plum, fleshy black cherry, cake spice and a confectionary note framed in velvety tannins.

title: Château de Santenay 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: A ripe combination of red fruits and powerful tannins gives this wine its density and also potential. It is full of acidity as well as berry fruits, layered with tannins and touches of wood aging. With this concentration, the wine will certainly age. Drink from 2020.

title: Boroli 2012 Villero  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of stewed cherry, dill and a whiff of mocha lead the nose while the palate offers ripe black raspberry, sage, espresso and star anise. Bracing tannins give it a firm finish while a mineral note marks the close. Drink after 2022.

title: Bret Brothers 2014 Domaine la Soufrandière Climat Les Quarts  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)
description: This Becky Wasserman selection is bright, tangy and full of fruit. Apples and crisp pear flavors come through the spiciness to give an attractive, ripe biodynamic wine from the highest and stoniest part of the vineyard slope. It has a delicious aftertaste of fragrant citrus and minerality. The 2014 vintage is dedicated to Marc-Antoine Bret.
designation: Domaine la Soufrandière Climat Les Quarts

title: Dalton 2013 D Series Zinfandel (Galilee)
description: Deep garnet in color, this wine has a nose of blackberry, cranberry and rose petal. It is simultaneously bright yet profound on the palate, with flavors of black currant, red plum, pomegranate, licorice and a hint of green pepper. Soft tannins linger through a spicy but bright finish.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2012 Symonette Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Listed as old vine, age unspecified, this offers a smooth core of rhubarb and pomegranate fruit. It's textural and laced through with flavors of Dr. Pepper, chocolate and caramel. Open and appealing, it's a wine to savor rather than save.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)
description: This bracing, tangy wine bursts forth with citrus flesh and rind, especially oranges, and a flash of pineapple. Zippy and mouth-puckering acidity make it a fun pairing with a wide variety of river fish and shellfish. A whiff of pine needle accents the finish.

title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2014  Chambolle-Musigny
description: This wine is soft, with attractive, aromatic red fruits. It has the round, ripe feel typical of the village, with just a tannic touch to keep it together. At the moment, the wine is all fruit and acidity, and it needs to develop further to bring out its secondary flavors. Drink from 2017.

title: Domaine des Valanges 2014 Hors Classe  (Saint-Véran)
description: Crisp and fruity, this bright, textured wine has a tangy character that is juicy and refreshing. Lively and rich, it is ready to drink although it will be better from 2017.

title: Vinkara 2012 Reserve Kalecik Karasi (Ankara)
description: Colored like dark rubies, this wine has a bouquet of black cherry, anise and eucalyptus. A satiny network of tannins provides a backdrop to flavors of black cherry, blackberry, eucalyptus, anise and white pepper. A nice sense of coolness persists through the mellow finish.
